resources.string: O Canada! Our home and native land! True patriot love in all thy sons command. With glowing hearts we see thee rise, The True North strong and free! From far and wide, O Canada, we stand on guard for thee. God keep our land glorious and free! O Canada, we stand on guard for thee. O Canada, we stand on guard for thee.

Alberta is a western province of Canada. With a population of 3645257 in 2011 and an estimated population of 4145992 as of October 1 2014, it is Canada is fourth-most populous province and most populous of Canada is three prairie provinces. It is bounded by the provinces of British Columbia to the west and Saskatchewan to the east, the Northwest Territories to the north, and the US state of Montana to the south. Alberta is one of three Canadian provinces and territories to border only a single US state and is also one of only two provinces that are landlocked

British Columbia, also commonly referred to by its initials BC, is a province located on the west coast of Canada. British Columbia is also a component of the Pacific Northwest and the Cascadia bioregion, along with the US states of Oregon and Washington. The province is name was chosen in 1858 by members of the Hudson is Bay Company. In 1871, it became the sixth province of Canada. Its Latin motto is Splendor sine occasu Splendour without Diminishment. The capital of British Columbia is Victoria, the fifteenth largest metropolitan region in Canada, named for the Queen who created the Colony of British Columbia.

Manitoba is a province located at the longitudinal centre of Canada. It is one of the three prairie provinces and is the fifth-most populous province in Canada, with a population of 1.208.268 as of 2011. Manitoba covers an area of 649.950 square kilometres and has a widely varied landscape the southern and western regions are predominantly prairie grassland, the eastern and northern regions are dominated by the Canadian Shield, and the far northern regions along the Hudson Bay coast are arctic tundra. The province is bounded by Saskatchewan to the west, Ontario to the east, Nunavut and Hudson Bay to the north, and the US states of North Dakota and Minnesota to the south.

Ontario is one of the ten provinces of Canada, located in east central Canada. It is Canada is most populous province by a large margin, accounting for nearly 40 percent of all Canadians, and is the second largest province in total area. Ontario is fourth largest in total area when the territories of the Northwest Territories and Nunavut are included. It is home to the nation is capital city, Ottawa, and the nation is most populous city, Toronto. Ontario is bordered by the province of Manitoba to the west, Hudson Bay and James Bay to the north, and Quebec to the east, and to the south by the US states of Minnesota, Michigan, Ohio, Pennsylvania and New York.
